content.question: A researcher collected data on the cholesterol level, <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the age, <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, of 24 people selected at random. Using the data, the researcher calculated the least-squares regression line to be <math alttext="C hat equals 182 plus 2.2 times A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover><mo>=</mo><mn>182</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>2.2</mn><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and the standard error of the slope to be 0.38. If the conditions for inference are met, which of the following is closest to the value of the test statistic to test the hypotheses <math alttext="H sub 0: beta equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>β</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> versus <math alttext="H sub a: beta is not equal to 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>β</mi><mo>≠</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

topic.text: 9.5: Carrying Out a Test for the Slope of a Regression Model

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Calculate a test statistic and find a p-value, provided conditions for inference are met.
